RD_LOWER_WO_SW: Lower if w/o sidewalks (can look weird ingame)
RD_NO_STOP_START: Do not stop at start intersection
RD_NO_STOP_END: Do not stop at end intersection
TP_DELETE_BORDER_MESH_WARNING: Are you sure you want to remove the selected railing?
BLOCK_NUMBER_TOOLTIP:
Used only for MM2, if not empty and greater than 0 it will override the automatic assignment.
Be careful when using it in conjunction with railings, as it could lead to unexpected results.
RD_SW_UV_TOOLTIP:
Fixes the UV coordinates of the sidewalks vertical border face.
Not supported in MM2
RD_ECHO_TOOLTIP: For galleries and underground roads, adds an echo to the sound when on it
UV_MULT_TOOLTIP:
Multiplies the U/V texure coordinate by this amount
Not supported in MM2
RD_RD_HEIGHT_TOOLTIP: Always 0.15 in MM2. If set to a value different than 0.15, the sidewalk will be slanted in MM2
TP_MERGE_TOOLTIP:
If checked, when exporting for MM2, this patch will be assigned to the same block of other connected patches which have this flag set too (note: connected means: at least one edge in common)
Note: be careful if you add railings, as they can only be placed on the block perimeter
PROP_ELEM_RND_TOOLTIP:
If unchecked, meshes are chosen sequentially, if checked, randomly.
Even if checked the result won't be exactly the same as in MM2, since there props are placed according to an apparently random pattern (which is always the same though)
UV_MULT_SW_TOOLTIP: Multiplies the U coordinate for road-style sidewalks by this amount. Not supported in MM2 (equivalent is 1)
RD_ECHO_TOOLTIP: For galleries and underground roads, adds an echo to the sound when on it
RD_FIX_SIDEWALKS_UV_TOOLTIP: Uses road-style UV coordinates for the sidewalks. Use sparingly, as it may look bad (or even break in MM2) when the sidewalk does not have 4 distinct sides (e.g. when going from a road with sidewalks to another without them)
RD_COPLANAR_TOOLTIP:
In Midtown Madness 2 the road colliders are quads, this means that the 4 corner vertices must be coplanar to make the mesh the same as the collider.
Roads that bend only on one axis (Y (left-right) or Z (up-down)) are not a problem.
The problem arises when a road bends on both the Y and Z axes (e.g. a curved slope).
This option tries to make the segments of such roads coplanar by rearranging the vertices.
This does not always work, if the curve is not slight the result will be horrible.
FIX_BOUND_TOOLTIP:
If checked, it will duplicate the facade bound and assign it to the block in front of it in addition to the block behind it.
This can help make the bound work consistently. (in case it doesn't always work)
Use sparingly.
On building lines it is only used if 'front only' is checked
EXPORT_PSDL_CAP_MATERIALS_TOOLTIP:
Stock MM2 and tools like MM2 City Toolkit cannot handle PSDL files with more than 511 textures, enabling this flag will cap texture IDs to 511 if greater.
It will break them though if this happens, use it only for testing.
If disabled, there is still a cap of 2047 materials.
RD_LOWER_WO_SW_TOOLTIP: It will look weird if the road is connected to an intersection where other roads have sidewalks, as they will always be 15cm high ingame
RD_WARP_TOOLTIP: For PSDL rooms that lay atop another, e.g. when there's a bridge going over something
